intro: Boberella bella-donna, commonly known as nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia, and it thrives in temperate climates. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, often blooming in summer. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a slightly hairy texture. Boberella bella-donna contains toxic alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals if ingested.
